title: Tyler Perry's House of Payne - Test Pilot Eps. (2006)
description:
House of Payne
Test Pilot Episodes 
(2006)

The sitcom ran in first-run syndication for 10 episodes during mid-2006 on the Atlanta-area broadcast of WPCH-TV, along with nine other broadcast outlets across the country, as a limited run, with additional episodes to be available for national distribution on TBS in June 2007 (thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s where the actual Season 1 starts). An order of 100 episodes was later requested by TBSÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ and on and on and on it continuedÃ¢â‚¬Â¦

These are considered as test pilot episodes.  These episodes are somewhat different from the current series considering that Ella and Curtis were C.J.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s parents, instead of aunt and uncle as they are currently portrayed, and Calvin Payne didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t exist.  Demetria McKinney was not a primary cast member.

------------------

I got this from eB years ago and it was definitely originally recorded from television.  I had to dump it on my DVD Recorder (standard definition) and separate the episodes.
Audio seems to be 2.0 ch (so says my encoder).
Overall A/V is so so, but it is definitely watchable; and for lovers of the show it should be just fine or fair enough

------------------

Closed Captions are an option.

------------------

Eps 1 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ The Roof Is On Fire (6/21/06)
C.J. Payne and his wife, Janine, are happily married with two children and live in a nice home. When their house catches on fire, they are forced to move in under the roof of C.J.'s parents, Curtis and Ella, and no one is happy with the present situation.

Eps 2 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ When the Smoke Clears Out (6/21/06)
C.J. and Janine's relationship starts to get worse when C.J. finds out that Janine hasn't been paying the bills for their house. Meanwhile, Curtis and Malik start bonding after the television system blows up.

Eps 3 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ The Invasion (Pt. 1) (6/28/06)
Curtis has problems with Malik's new outfit and C.J.'s current living condition puts him in a bad mood. To be continued...

Eps 4 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ	 The Invasion (Pt. 2) / Take It Or Leave It (6/28/06)
C.J. is attracted to Malik's math teacher, Miss Nicole Jamieson (Rochelle Aytes). Meanwhile, Ella has to tell Claretha some bad news about her involvement with the church.

Eps 5 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Home Alone (Pt. 1) (7/5/06)
C.J. is left home in the house with his kids and Claretha while Curtis and Ella go out of town for the weekend. To be continued...

Eps 6 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Home Alone (Pt. 2) / IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve Got the Hook Up (7/5/06)
C.J. tries to get back in the dating scene, but his efforts are thwarted as Pops and Claretha follow him during his date with Claretha's daughter, Huretha. Meanwhile, Curtis tries to have his monthly poker game while babysitting his grandchildren at the same time.

Eps 7 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ EllaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s War (7/12/06)
While Curtis is away, Ella gets a visit from Janine who asks Ella to help her get her life together. Things get serious between C.J. and Malik's math teacher.

Eps 8 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ No Place Like Home (7/12/06)
After finishing her stay in rehab, Janine asks Ella if she could move back in.

Eps 9 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Divided We Fall (7/19/06)
When Ella gets sick, Curtis takes on more responsibilities. C.J. struggles to adapt to living with Janine again.

Eps 10 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Big Baller, Shot Caller (7/19/06)
In the final episode of the test pilot episodes, While C.J. is less than inclined to meet Janine's new boyfriend (Michael Jai White), Curtis studies painting.
